title: Suggest named lifetime on trait functions like we do for free functions

labels.name: E-easy
labels.description: Call for participation: Experience needed to fix: Easy / not much (good first issue)

labels.name: C-enhancement
labels.description: Category: An issue proposing an enhancement or a PR with one.

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: A-suggestion-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: suggestions generated by the compiler applied by cargo fix

labels.name: D-newcomer-roadblock
labels.description: Confusing diagnostic error hard to understand for new users

body:
The following `fn foo` [provides a structured suggestion to add a new named lifetime]():

```rust
fn foo(x: &i32, y: &i32) -> Option<&i32> {
    Some(y)
}
```
```
error[E0106]: missing lifetime specifier
 --> src/lib.rs:1:36
  |
1 | fn foo(x: &i32, y: &i32) -> Option<&i32> {
  |           ----     ----            ^ expected named lifetime parameter
  |
  = help: this function's return type contains a borrowed value, but the signature does not say whether it is borrowed from `x` or `y`
help: consider introducing a named lifetime parameter
  |
1 | fn foo<'a>(x: &'a i32, y: &'a i32) -> Option<&'a i32> {
  |       ^^^^    ^^^^^^^     ^^^^^^^            ^^^
```

But [similar code in a trait, doesn't](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=6baac349d80a086af3fe7f0da4c70cc4):

```rust
trait T {
    fn foo(&self, x: &i32, y: &i32) -> Option<&i32> {
        Some(y)
    }
}
```
```
error[E0623]: lifetime mismatch
 --> src/lib.rs:3:9
  |
2 |     fn foo(&self, x: &i32, y: &i32) -> Option<&i32> {
  |                               ----     ------------
  |                               |
  |                               this parameter and the return type are declared with different lifetimes...
3 |         Some(y)
  |         ^^^^^^^ ...but data from `y` is returned here
```

[The method `add_missing_lifetime_specifiers_label`](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/f60513ec8d97414a346cedb755a4cac3abd55ed1/src/librustc_resolve/late/diagnostics.rs#L1080-L1209) is the one responsible for the former suggestion and can probably be easily reused where [the method lifetime issue is emitted](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/224ad326ea4c9d32309fbd46592661a464360b8d/src/librustc_infer/infer/error_reporting/nice_region_error/different_lifetimes.rs).

_Thanks to https://users.rust-lang.org/t/this-parameter-and-the-return-type-are-declared-with-different-lifetimes/45200 for making me notice this discrepancy._
